item.title: How to access Windows' OneDrive folder from Linux
item.description: My friend had some files in the OneDrive folder on Windows’ partition, wondering how to access them directly from Linux (because of the unsupported reparse point error). Hence, this article was born. Install ntfs-3g (with FUSE support so you can mount drives without sudo). Download the plugin from Web Archive. Extract the zip and place the plugin (ntfs-plugin-9000001a.so in linux-64 or other platforms) under /usr/lib/ntfs-3g/. You might need to create the folder yourself.

item.title: About
item.description: Open Source advocate. Composer. Programmer. Pro-gamer. Likes Gamelan.Living somewhere around (24°N, 121°E) on earth. Linux Tried various distros since 2018, including Ubuntu, elementary OS, Linux Mint, Zorin OS, Ubuntu Studio, AV Linux, Feren OS, KDE neon, Regata OS, MX Linux, Nitrux, Manjaro, Arch Linux, Archcraft, Garuda Linux, Void Linux and openSUSE Thumbleweed. Now live on CachyOS. I also recommend Zorin OS. Music Play the clarinet and the piano whilst mostly compose for concert band and piano.
